page.title: 04EDUCATION:NOTTINGHAM JUNIORS
page.content: Porchester is a typical primary school and lies in the suburb of Carlton.It takes seven to eleven year olds and was built in 1908.The building is of red brick and consists of eight classrooms clustered around a central hall in which we eat,hold assemblies and have P.E. lessons on wet days.It stands on a small plot of land which is half grass and half concrete,but we don't have our own playing field as many schools do.All 162 pupils go to assembley each morning,then have a variety of lessons which are interrupted by two twenty minute breaks and an hour and a quarter for lunch.We leave school at 3.45pm.During the year there are sport's days,parents' evenings,outings and jumble sales to raise money and make our school part of the community Scott Poxon(10).
